content:
Ozark is a fantastic show, and Jason Bateman's performance is indeed outstanding.

As for finishing the first season within a week, it's definitely doable, but it depends on your viewing habits and schedule. Here's a rough estimate of the time commitment:

* Ozark Season 1 has 10 episodes, with an average runtime of around 55-60 minutes per episode.
* Assuming you watch 2-3 episodes per day, you can finish the season in 3-5 days.
* If you prefer to watch 1 episode per day, it'll take you around 10 days to complete the season.

Keep in mind that Ozark is a show that benefits from binge-watching, as the story unfolds gradually and the tension builds over time. However, it's also a show that requires some emotional investment and processing time, so you might want to pace yourself to fully absorb the plot twists and character developments.

To make the most of your Ozark experience, I recommend setting aside dedicated time to watch each episode, and try to avoid rushing through the season. The show's atmosphere and tension are carefully crafted, and you'll want to give yourself time to appreciate the performances, cinematography, and writing.

Remember, it's not a race to finish the season; it's about enjoying the journey and immersing yourself in the world of the Ozarks.

How many episodes do you think you can realistically commit to watching per day?
